captions.text: Hello, everybody!
My name is Markiplier, and welcome to the "Outlast: Whistleblower" DLC!
Now, Outlast was one of my favorite games from recent years...
...and the Whistleblower DLC should prove to be a very good extension on what was already a good formula.
Outlast was great! Obviously, it's at the top of my list of great horror games and one of my favorite playthroughs, but...
...I'm really hoping that the Whistleblower DLC adds something really cool.
What is going on now?
I'm waking up in a bit of a fog...
...oh, hello...
...you here to help me?!
Are you here to hurt me?
...Okay.
Oh, I'm dead. Oh, I'm not dead. Am I dead?
What are you doing to me...?
Why do you need radiation suits to help me?!
(Andrew) Open those eyes. You don't have to wake up, but open your eyes.
(Mark) OKAY THEY'RE OPEN

They're about as op... OW.
(Andrew) What's the matter? Did somebody hit you?
(Mark) ...huh?!
(Andrew) Here. Let me help.
(Mark) ...dickbag! EW! AHH!
NOOOOO!

Stop that!
(Technician) Andrew?

(Mark) U-hgh!
(Technician) You're getting these alerts?
(Andrew) Kinda busy here.
(Mark) Really?!
(Technician) It sounds like real trouble. At the Engine. They said Hope made a lateral ascension.
(Mark) Oh.
(Andrew) Billy Hope? Shit. And they're not happy about it?
(Mark) Huh?

(Technician) No.
(Andrew) Shit. Shit, shit, shit. Come on.
(Mark) I'm still upset about the fact that you gave me a Wet Willie!
Or a Wet Wallie, because you literally just used your tongue and didn't lick your finger...
...what's going on here?
Oh, I can move!
Ooooohh.
"2 hours earlier."
So does this take place during the course of two hours?
Is that what you're trying to tell me here?
"You don't know me. Have to make this quick. They might be monitoring."
"I did 2 weeks of software consult at MURKOFF Psychiatric Systems' facilities in Mount Massive."
"All sorts of NDA's I'm very much breaking right now..."
That is the letter from the first part of the game, that the reporter Miles Upshur...
...or Mike Upaar...
...got and I'm the guy that is actually telling the story about what is going on at Mount Massive asylum.
Just to catch you guys up on what's actually happening.
And I'm willing to bet that this isn't going to go too well for this guy.
He's gonna get to finish this e-mail and he's gonna get a Wet Wallie in his... back side of his ear.
Ogh.
One of the other things that needs to be said...
Oh, send.

Send that bad boy!
(Security) Who's in here?

(Mark) NO ONE'S IN HERE!
(Security) What are you doing?
(Mark) NOT DOING ANYTHING!
Playing games, watching porn...
...you don't need to be worried about anything.
Hello!

Hey!
(Mark) Park?

They've paged for you three times already, there's something urgent at the engine.
(Mark) Oh, okay. Oh, okay.

Yeah, because Billy Hope is about to...
(Security) What were you doing in there anyway?

I thought you were just a software guy.
(P. A.) Waylon Park, employee one four six six...
(Mark) Yeah, there was, uuuh... software in there!

I'm just a weirdo I.T. guy, don't mind me.
(P. A.) ...report to Morphogenic Engine Monitoring immediately.
...are you the guy that licked my ear?

(scientist 1) ...but those are precursors to precursors.
(Mark) Yeah.

(scientist 1) I'm worried about losing antiapoptotics.
(Mark) Really?
(scientist 2) One ninety isn't bad. The doctor was predicting assembly by one fifty.

(Mark) This is an interesting conversation.
(Scientist 1) We're not being given enough information to trust Wernicke's predictions.

(Mark) Okay.
(Scientist 2) He's been right so far.
(Mark) Maybe.
(Scientist 1) I just want to know we're inventing something other than shiny new cancers."
(Mark) Okay. Cool!

You're inventing a diabolical demon...
(P. A.) ...stress response is going to affect the capillaries.
...that's gonna rip apart every single person in here.
(agent) Why weren't you answering the page?
(Mark) UUUH PORN
(agent) I'll tell them you're incoming.
(Mark) Thank you, sir.
How about you?
Am I not supposed to go that way?
All right.
This is back towards the end of the first game!
Oh, by the way, if you haven't seen the first part...
...if you haven't seen Outlast in the beginning, it's one of my best playthroughs...
...and I love it to death.

You can find the link in the description below to get the whole story.
(guard) Christ, Waylon, hurry up, they're waiting on you.
(Mark) Thank you.
Thank you, sir. Sorry to keep them waiting.

(Mark) Doing some urgent business that you need not be afrai- wait a minute
- Ah, Park. You're cutting it close.

Next patient's incoming and Arterial Spin's still dark.
(Mark) Cool!

- We need you at the front terminal.
(Mark) Gotcha.
(Steve) They got Gluskin out of his cell.
(Mark) Yeah.
(Steve) Page him again. We need this Park guy in here now.
(Mark) I am here!
(Steve) Tell him he's got fifteen seconds to keep his job. Christ...
(Mark) I'm right here! Jeez... Oh! I get it, I get it, I get it, I get it.

(Steve) Park. Finally.
(Mark) Yeah!
(Steve) Where have you been? The Functional Imaging interface isn't talking to the ASL."

(Mark) I dunno.
(Steve) We got a patient thirty seconds out and we're blind inside his head.
(Mark) Okay. You are definitely the guy who licked my ear.
(Steve) No. I don't need another performance evaluation.
(Mark) Yeah.
(Steve) Mr. Park here is going to have us up and running before we even know it. Right, Mr. Park?
(Mark) Right, boss!
You got it.
I'm here to help.
Not to make everything go wonky crazy.
Psycho bonkers.
Ogh.
For some reason I'm reminded of Half-Life... uh... the Half-Life opening.
(technician) Uh, Steve? fMRI is still dark.
(Mark) It's a functional MRI, by the way.
(Steve) You're doubting our friend Mr. Waylon Park.
Which I consider more than unkind to his programming skill and considerable dedication to the Murkoff corporation.

(Mark) Yeah! This guy's on my side.
(Steve) F*ck me They're bringing him in.
(Mark) He likes me a little too much, if you know what I mean.
Oh, is that the guy?
(patient) No! No! Not again!
(Mark) Is that Billy Hope?
(patient) No! No! Jack-booted fucks, I know what you've been doing to me.
I know what you've been...
Help! Help me! Help me, they're gonna rape me! Rape! RAPE!
(Mark) Euuuugh.
This is going off to a great start, I can...
OH HI!
(patient) Don't let them do this!
(Mark) Hey, handsome, how ya doing?
(patient) I know you can stop this!
(Mark) ...I didn't...
(patient) You have to help me! You have to!

(agent) Hey! Calm yourself. This is a high security...
(Steve) It's alright, agent.

(Mark) WHAT DID I DO?!
(Steve) Mr. Park was just surprised.
(Mark) Yeah!
(Steve) I'm sure he's still calm and eager to finish his work.
(Mark) Calm and eager for you to lick my ear.
Thank you, friend.
(Steve) Quickly, Mr. Park. A head will need to roll if perfusion monitoring is not active when they put him in the engine.
(Mark) Cool.

(Steve) Five seconds.
(Mark) Alright.
(Syeve) Four. Three...
(Mark) OH HI.
You are Billy Hope, aren't you?
I remember that setup you got going on there.
This is gonna go good.
Eugh!

Oh, that poor... oh.
(Steve) You're finished, Mr. Waylon Park.
You may leave. Don't expect anything but honesty in my review of your performance.
(Mark) Thank you.
I know you'll be nothing but kind to me.
Y'all are really weird.
What happens if I stay?!
(Steve) Thank you and goodbye.
(Mark) Uh... I'm just gonna hang around for a little bit and watch all of your cool things going on here.
'He had five kinds of cancer...'
I... there's so much talking going on that I can't see what's going on in the dialog down below.
Uhhhh... Okay. I'm outta here.
'Childhood sexual reptile imagery'...?
What the hell is that?!
Someone draw some f... no, nuh... gah...
What is that?! What in the world are you talking about in there?
You are very weird.
And things are about to go very, VERY wrong.
And I just called a reporter over riiiiight when things are about to go to hell.
Good.
Can I go back to my little desk inside of a dark room...
...where I can just send e-mails to random strangers?
... ...from Close Encounters
Okay.
So, uh...
Oh, I am supposed to go back in here.
Okay. You got it.
Just go back...
(Jeremy Blaire) Somebody's been telling stories outside of class.
(Mark)MO-AGH!

(Mark)MO-AGH!
Sorry!
(agent) Hands where I can see them!
(Mark) They are right here!
Hi, friend! Thank you.
(Blaire) Mr. Waylon Park. Consulting contract 8208.
Software engineer with a level 3 security clearance.
(Mark) Yeah.

(Blaire) Graduated cum laude from Berkley...
(Mark) That's me.
(Blaire) ...but still somehow not smart enough to realize that the last thing a fly ought to do in a spider's web is wiggle.
(Mark) EUGH!!
Cool.
(Blaire) Somehow dumb enough to think...
...that a borrowed laptop, an onion router, and a firewall patch...
...would be enough to fool the world's leading supplier of biometric security.
(Mark) Heeeeey, what's your problem, man?
(Blaire) Stupid, Mr. Park.
(Mark) Ooooh no. Yes, so stupid.
(Blaire) In fact, that was... crazy.
(Mark) Yeagh.
(Blaire)I'm afraid we're going to have to have you committed.
(Mark) Oh no ho ho ho.

(Blaire)Mr. Park, will you willingly submit to forced confinement?
(Mark) Heugh heugh heugh.

(Blaire) Did you hear that, agent?
(Mark) Uh...
(Agent) He said yes, Mr. Blaire.
(Mark) Oooh okay.
(Blaire) Oh, and... did I just hear Mr. Waylon Park volunteer for the Morphogenic Engine Program?

(Mark) Yes.
(Agent) That's what I heard, Mr. Blaire.
(Mark) What!?
(Blaire) That was brave, indeed, Waylon.
The Murkoff Corporation and the onward march of science both appreciate your bravery and sacrifice.
Maybe you could administer Mr. Park here a light anesthetic...
(Mark) Oh, I wonder what this is gonna be...Yup! That's what I thought.
Oh, jeez! Was that necessary?!
Okay! Alright! Now we're actually into it!
That was one Hell of an opening, you gotta admit.
Holy Hell! Jeez, man. You light up on me. I just sent one email.
Oh, now I'm here! I thought that was at the end of the game. Was th---Oh.
[screaming]
Okay. That was burned into my brain. That's good.
If I remember, The Morphogenic Engine is like a series of images that instills...
...it causes brain changes that---oh hi.
Shh. Okay. Sorry.
It causes brain changes that allows the person to tap into the psychotic world.

(patient) You hear that, don't you? Do you hear it? Oh... Ah...
(Mark) Or the psychic....HI, BILLY.
Bye, Billy.

comments.author: CynicalBastard

comments.text:
Fun fact! A whistleblower is a person who exposes illegal activity within 
ones business, hence the title of the DLC since Waylon sends that email to 
expose Mount Massive Asylums experimentations. 
I know this might have been totally obvious to a lot of people, but I just 
learned this in my business class and thought it was an awesome realization 
XD﻿

comments.author: The Arts

comments.text:
I know that no-one cares, but I've got my own little headcanon for the 
Outlast series that I'm turning into a fanfiction. Before she married and 
had children with Waylon, Lisa's name was Lisa Upshur. She was Miles' 
sister. One day, possibly during a date, she'd told Waylon her brother was 
an investigative reporter. This is why he went to Miles to expose Mt 
Massive's effed uppiness and why Lisa has colourful language, similar to 
Miles while Waylon is said to have a less brash personality based on 
gameplay and his own notes.

What do you guys think? Plausible?﻿
